title: Oh for fuck sake riot.
body:
Had to reinstall league, have shitty net so said "fuck it ill let it download while im at work, its only going to take 3-4 hours to download even if telstra dicks me hard today and dc's my net a few times so itl be done by the time i get home"

get home after a hard days work fucking breaking rocks in a fucking quarry in the fucking sun.

want to relax and take the load off with some league.

Turn on my monitor "there has been a fatal error while downloading the install"

Think to myself "well no shit riot my net dc's sometimes it probably just cut out mid download"

Suddenly it hits me "wait it says retry, dont fucking tell me riot didnt code in a basic fucking failsafe to check if network connectivity has been reattained"

Download starts off at 1.4 gigs

I started it at 1.8

It got 400 fucking megabytes in, lost connection, then because of some fucking amateur fuckwit on the client team didn't have the fucking initiative to say "wait if we just add the .net library to the client we can actually monitor weather or not the system has an internet connection and just pause the download while it doesn't and resume when it reattains connection, you know, like every single other fucking patcher in existence from a large game like ours"

Actually knowing riots incompetency someone probably did suggest that and got fired for it.

Like fuck dude, ive only been coding for 6 years and i only dabble in game bots so ive never fucking touched code like riots client, and im still confident that i could do a better fucking job.

Like lets break down what the client is yeah.

5 images with hyperlinks attached to them, thats easy enough you can do that with html for christ sakes, let alone a decent oop language, so thats a non factor i can do that.

Some of those links open inside the client you say? pffft easy just code into the program a very very basic web browser and load the page with css script and all, granted if you want to go fancy like riot did you can, but its still just a basic gui thats parsing text.

Next.

Home button in the top left corner? easy anyone can do that, first thing they teach you in a visual basic course is how to make a button. So you make that button, and you use a function call tied to that button like say Home() and when you call Home it loads the front page, ezpz.

Progress bar? Ezpz just download a file list, calculate a percentage based on that list, for every file that completes bump the percentage up a touch by the calculated value, badda bing badda boom progress bar.

Region switcher? also easy its just more buttons, which in turn change a variable.

What is that variable? that variable is the region variable that is used by other functions to determine which files to load.

Next please.

Help? more buttons again, repair button just does a verification of the files to a downloaded md5 checksum and if it finds any anomalies it redownloads them.

Player support? just load the player support website inside the client, like the patch notes, thats actually an improvement on the current method of just opening it in your browser btw.

logs is simple, just push log files out and start a new log when pressed.

About standard practice here doesn't even need explaining.

Options are simple again.

I think we get the point, a 5 year old could've coded the current league client.

Not one feature of it actually requires some super advanced coding knowledge.

So how could i do it better? simple, im not a dumb shit who just went "lets put everything in the one client because that couldnt possibly fuck up"

For instance, i would personally separate the repair client from the patcher, the patcher could still be used to launch the repair client as it is now by just calling the repair.exe file, but it would save complete fuck ups where the patcher breaks, as currently the only solution to that is a complete reinstall, as riot doesn't include the repair function in the installer leaving your only repair button inside the patcher.

And trust me, the patcher breaks, alot.

Something else i would do is apply the aforementioned network check to allow for automatic resumption of patching.

And id also allow for selection of the download folder as in this day and age most of us run a 120gb ssd for the os and frankly having to download the league install files to that drive tends to not work out (i have to perform hdd management magic every time i want to reinstall league, despite league fitting on the drive before the reinstall (because again fucking logic right))

Id also add a button to completely migrate league installs so users dont have to go trawling through their regedits looking for any related registry files (though i have a feeling there arent any because in this day and age id sure hope people have learnt to fucking code a dynamic directory using the parent directory of the .exe)

replies.body: I hate to be the one, but it looks like you need better Internet. Try upgrading from your Dial-up and get something a little more modern, fam.

I have 500gb adsl 2+ from telstra.

Remember when i said telstra dicking me hard.

Not dodo being dodo like usual.

More specifically telstra has been going maintenance crazy at my post code.

But its my issues that made me realise just how much is wrong with the client.

namely the measures to solve issues like this just simply dont exist, you cant provide a product where you expect every customer to have the ideal setup at all times, you have to take common issues (like net drop outs) and solve them on the product end to the best of your capacity, that way if the user still fucks up its on them not you.

For instance the whole cant repair the patcher because the repair program is the patcher?

Thats just dumb fucking design.

Thats like providing a "break glass if emergency" but the thing you break the glass with is inside the glass.

Great for contemporary art about how societal constructs hold us back.

Not so great for efficient product design.

tbh if you lag that much with nobody home in the middle of the day, then you probably shouldn't be playing LoL at all, let alone during peak hours for internet traffic. It's up to you to fix it, too. Either you live too far from the exchange, or phone line needs to be repaired. If it's the latter then Telstra is liable and legally has to send someone to identify where the fault is and repair it.

EDIT: Also, Riot is already in the process of updating the client. I'm sure if you brought this up and rationally explained the issue Riot would happily work with you to come up with a solution.
I dont lag i get 50ms, again maintenance is what causes the dc's not shitty net.
